image.altText: A man sits at a desk.

props.synopsis: A Queensland businessman who credits his success with "doing God's will, God's way" has had a lease for a coal mine in Tasmania's north-east cancelled after his company stopped paying rent for 12 months.

title.children: Mining lease cancelled for 'God's will' businessman after rent not paid

image.altText: Shipping in the port of Burnie, Tasmania.

props.synopsis: The privatisation of public assets has been a recurring theme across Australia for four decades, but one state has been relatively immune to the trend: Tasmania.

title.children: Tasmania has been immune to privatisation, but has it worked elsewhere?

image.altText: a replica tall ship sailing the River Derwent

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian replica tall ship, based on a 1800s ship pivotal to Hobart's colonial settlement, set sail with an all-female crew to celebrate this weekend's International Women's Day.

title.children: Pirates looted the Lady Nelson, her replica sails on, crewed by women

image.altText: A Hmong man and woman in wide-brimmed hats harvest from a row of kale with bushland behind them

props.synopsis: From a war-torn childhood in Laos, Dee Thao found her place in Tasmania as a market gardener. While she followed in her parents' footsteps, her children don't feel the same pull to continue the Hmong farming tradition.

title.children: Tasmanian Hmong children not carrying on family's farming tradition

image.altText: A supermarket vacuum package of Huon Aquaculture roasted salmon

props.synopsis: A video released earlier this week of live and dead salmon being sealed into tubs has led to a leading animal welfare suspending its certification.

title.children: RSPCA suspends Huon Aquaculture certification over live fish disposal

image.altText: a fledgling orange bellied parrot held by two pairs of gloved hands

props.synopsis: Almost 30 of the critically endangered birds have been released from captivity, buoying expectations for a record-breaking winter migration this year.

title.children: 'Another record' expected as more captive-bred orange-bellied parrots released

image.altText: An empty commercial street is covered by water

props.synopsis: Showers are expected to ease across sodden south-east Queensland, but several flood warnings remain in place following ex-Cyclone Alfred, with extensive flooding recorded in Queensland's Lockyer Valley.

title.children: Heavy rainfall eases in wake of ex-Cyclone Alfred as flood warnings continue

image.altText: The back of a man being escorted into the back of a police vehicle by two detectives wearing suits

props.synopsis: Strike Force Pearl detectives have charged 14 people with dozens of offences in connection with a spate of antisemitic incidents across Sydney.

title.children: Detectives charge 14 in connection with Sydney antisemitic incidents

image.altText: An artists' impression of the war memorial showing a fighter jet in a large exhibition space.

props.synopsis: Will a massive expansion of the Australian War Memorial allow it to evolve or destroy what makes it special?

title.children: 'Disneyland of war': The war memorial's divisive transformation

image.altText: A woman makes moonshine in Bihar, India.

props.synopsis: A ban on alcohol created to protect women from domestic violence in India's Bihar has bred a criminal underworld.

title.children: A state with 130 million people banned booze. It unleashed chaos

image.altText: Man with floodwaters up to his shins stands with dog in backyard

props.synopsis: Working out how to claim insurance is confusing at the best of times. Here's how to claim, and the steps to take to make the insurance process easier.

title.children: So, your house is flooded. Here's how to claim insurance

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer says he is heartbroken to reveal his brain cancer has returned after revolutionary treatment kept the aggressive tumour at bay for more than 18 months.

title.children: 'I'm not ready to die': Professor Richard Scolyer's heartbreaking prognosis

image.altText: An intricate golden star shape above capital letters that spell out "The Star" advertising a casino.

props.synopsis: Against all odds, Star Entertainment has managed to avoid sliding into administration for now. But its near demise poses bigger problems for a glittering world that risks being consigned to a bygone era.

title.children: A former pro poker player, Star's CEO has pulled off a stone-cold bluff

image.altText: Trump-Turnbull teaser box image

props.synopsis: The US president's social media broadside came after Mr Turnbull criticised him on US television.

title.children: 'Bipartisan gaslighting': Turnbull reacts to Trump's personal attack

image.altText: The Stena Immaculate, a large commercial shipping vessel, sitting at a dock.

props.synopsis: Authorities say 32 people who sustained injuries have been brought to shore following the collision off the north-eastern coast of England.

title.children: Tanker hired by US military ablaze off UK coast after strike by container ship

image.altText: White rectangular, concrete building with glass windows and brown glass entrance way and blue sky.

props.synopsis: With a federal election on the horizon in May, both the opposition and intelligence analysts have warned that there's a risk the report will remain buried forever.

title.children: Fears intelligence report will remain buried forever as election approaches

image.altText: Head and shoulder shot of Mike Nahan

props.synopsis: Former WA Liberal leader Mike Nahan blasts his colleagues for failing to provide a "coherent alternative" ahead of the party's latest election rout, saying upper house MPs did not do enough to engage with the community.

title.children: 'Didn't get off their bums': Liberal blame game begins after WA election

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: Suddenly, working from home is being debated in Canberra. But who benefits if it becomes an election issue?

title.children: The work from home debate is 'dangerous territory' for politicians

image.altText: Two middle-aged men, one in a tight, olive green shirt and the other in a suit, shake hands in front of a woooden wall.

props.synopsis: Russia has told Australia there will be "grave consequences" if it puts "boots on the ground" in Ukraine as part of a Western peacekeeping operation proposed by UK Prime Minister Kier Starmer.

title.children: Russia warns Australia of 'grave consequences' if it sends peacekeepers to Ukraine

image.altText: A young, fair-haired man with a neat beard lies in bed. His nose is swollen and his face is bruised.

props.synopsis: A solicitor who was bashed in his home town says he was thinking "this could be it" as he was kicked and punched by a gang of young men.

title.children: Young lawyer haunted by savage bashing in Bendigo

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt with a white logo that says "DOGE" shows it off to the camera smiling

props.synopsis: The owner of X has announced the incident on his own platform after users around the world reported issues on the site.

title.children: Elon Musk says X outages due to 'massive cyberattack'

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy gestures as he talks to media

props.synopsis: Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with the Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Jeddah, as the Middle East nation tries to assert itself as a peace maker between Ukraine and Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy arrives in Saudi Arabia ahead of Ukraine peace talks

image.altText: Supporters of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol wave US and South Korean flags.

props.synopsis: Wearing symbolic white helmets and waving "Stop the Steal" flags, the young men of the "white skull squad" are back on the streets of South Korea and wanting the US to intervene in their country's democracy.

title.children: Young men are fuelling the rise of the 'White Skull Squad' in Korea

image.altText: Pope Francis in a wheelchair

props.synopsis: Doctors have determined Pope Francis is no longer in imminent danger of death as a result of pneumonia that has kept him hospitalised for nearly a month.

title.children: Pope Francis no longer in imminent danger due to pneumonia, doctors say

image.altText: Thick smoke over coastal bushland from above.

props.synopsis: The small WA communities of Windy Harbour and Northcliffe are battling challenging conditions and fatigue from a bushfire that has threatened both towns for more than a month.

title.children: Huge area of WA bushland torched by fire burning for more than a month

image.altText: Three women sit a timber meeting table.

props.synopsis: Samoa's first female prime minister ignored a taunt about her marital status in defeating the second attempt to oust her in two weeks.

title.children: Samoa's PM told to 'get married' so someone could 'advise' her properly

image.altText: The Star, Brisbane 2025-01-09 10:01:00

props.synopsis: An ICAC report which uncovered corrupt conduct against an unnamed senior executive in the NT public service has stayed largely out of the spotlight since its release in February.

title.children: Executive resigns after ICAC finds sick leave was spent fishing, at casino

image.altText: Meganne Christian wore a blue suit and is pictured inside a parabolic flight at zero gravity.

props.synopsis: Meganne Christian describes what it's like to undergo her first block of astronaut training at the European Astronaut Centre in Cologne, Germany.

title.children: Training to become an astronaut involves diving and a ride on the 'vomit comet'

image.altText: A pink piggy bank sits on a pile of Australian money

props.synopsis: More than 3 million Australians raided their retirement nest egg during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: Accessed your super early? Experts on if you should pay it back

props.synopsis: Former NSW treasurer Matt Kean has slammed his own party over its advocacy of nuclear power, calling plans to subsidise nuclear reactors "nonsense".

title.children: 'Like building a Blockbuster': Liberal slams party's nuclear plan

image.altText: A Rohingya girl feeds a child from a jar with the USAID logo on it

props.synopsis: The US usually provides almost half of the aid money spent on the humanitarian response to Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh.

title.children: Food rations for Rohingya cut to $9.50 a month after Trump USAID freeze

image.altText: Donald Trump meets with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as JD Vance reacts in the lavish White House Oval Office.

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump takes a less adversarial approach to Vladimir Putin, who else wins? Today, Dan Blumenthal from the American Enterprise Institute on what it all means for China's ambitions.

title.children: ABC News Daily: How China wins from Trump's pivot to Russia

image.altText: A young Thai woman in a traditional chut thai, and a man in a green police uniform

props.synopsis: Thitisan Utthanaphon was serving a life sentence in a Bangkok prison for murder.

title.children: Policeman 'Joe Ferrari' found dead in Thai prison

image.altText: Alex de Mimaur prepares to play a forehand at the Rotterdam Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur continues to fly the Aussie flag in California, storming into the Indian Wells fourth round.

title.children: De Minaur breezes into last 16 at Indian Wells
